messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Two cool links, and an unrelated expression of.... somet...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/28/03 11:13:30 AM, kbcdlovejo@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/28/03 11:13:30 AM, kbcdlovejo@... writes:

<< If she's doing her job, the student will soon bypass his teacher?

Congratulations! <G> >>

But I wasn't intending to...


Oh never mind.
Damn that free will and respect crap.

There ARE places I still would like to be controlling. <g> See? Admission
of discovering where I need to breathe and work on my own stuff. That, and I
need to eat.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Two cool links, and an unrelated expression of.... somet...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/28/2003 12:38:25 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Hah! Sandra, from the outside looking IN?  Isn t that what they say about *teachers*? If
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/28/2003 12:38:25 PM Eastern Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:

> Lately I'm nearly afraid myself!! Not really, but it's been really
> interesting that there are four or five (maybe more, I didn't really count)
>
> people who have been for a few weeks giving what seem like harsher and more
>
> extreme answers than I've ever given. I'm used to being the edge, and
> figuring if people got halfway between where they started and where I was
> that would be a lot of motion and progress. But lately it seems that from
> behind me and over my head people are shouting "HALFWAY SUCKS! KEEP MOVING
>
> THIS WAY NOW!"
>
> I'm not sure it's a bad thing, but I can say it's very, very different. <g>

Hah!

Sandra, from the outside looking IN? <G>

Isn't that what they say about *teachers*?

If she's doing her job, the student will soon bypass his teacher?

Congratulations! <G>

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
